Co-Working Day

July 23, 2014 in Uncategorized

We will be meeting this Friday for Co-Working day at Avent Ferry Technology Center, Room 106 from 8am – 5pm.

At this week’s Co-Working day, Charles Brabec will be there during the morning to answer any questions you might have about Shibboleth and how you can start using Shib for your projects. Charles has written some awesome documentation that you can find atÂ shib.ncsu.edu. So if you have questions, please stop by and visit.

by Lark Mullins

Co-Working Day

July 16, 2014 in Uncategorized

We will be meeting this Friday for Co-Working day at Avent Ferry Technology Center, Room 106 from 8am – 5pm.

This week Larry Robinson and Andrew Barnes, who are apart of the Tech Support Tools & Process Committee, which has been charged with researching products for Help Desk support across the university. They will be hacking on the different APIs that each vendor provides. If you want to checkout the three vendors in the running and hack on some APIs, please stop by at Co-working.

Co-Working Day

May 8, 2014 in Uncategorized

We will be meeting this Friday for Co-Working day at Avent Ferry Technology Center, Room 106 from 8am – 5pm.

This week we have Greg Kraus from OIT presenting “Why We Need ARIA and How to Implement It”. It is a presentation onÂ howÂ to use ARIA (Accessible Rich Internet Applications) techniques to make
interactive Web pages accessible to people with disabilities. His presentation starts at 9am.

After Greg’s presentation you can stay around for the rest of co-working.

by Mike Vysocka

Extension IT has new site / blog. Good stuff for WordPress Devs.

May 7, 2014 in Uncategorized

Yesterday we launched our new team site:Â http://eit.ces.ncsu.edu/

While there will certainly be an abundance of internally focused content on the site, you’re also likely to see us sharing:

  • Our latest enhancements to our massive WordPress install (slides here) including any plugins we’ve evaluated
  • What we’re doing with our mobile presence
  • Data points from our Google Analytics Account and lessons learned
  • Security alerts
  • Best practices for writing / designing contentÂ 

While there’s an RSS feed (http://eit.ces.ncsu.edu/feed/) for the site, we also have a MailChimp listÂ you can subscribe to for updates.

Does your team have a blog? If so, leave it in the comments. I’d love to follow it, and I’m sure others would too!

by Lisa Miles

Staff Position: Web Developer and Designer

April 30, 2014 in Uncategorized

Campus Life is seeking a Web Developer and Designer.

Position serves as the designer and programmer for Campus Life, providing primarily web application design and development and maintenance of existing web applications, such as RA program tracking, assignments sign ups, and operational tools. This position also supports the infrastructure for the sub-divisionâs Drupal web management software. Provides development, design, and support for the web pages utilizing PHP code. Coordinates with the Marketing Team to maintain their access to websites so users can make changes to web content as needed.

Experience in the following areas is required:
-PHP development including object-oriented PHP
-MySQL database administration
-Drupal CMS (content management system) development, including theme modification and custom code integration
-HTML/CSS/JavaScript/XML/RSS

Experience in the following areas is preferred:
-PHP interactions with Oracle through OCI8 functions
-Application development with the MVC (model-view-controller) pattern
-cPanel server management interface
-3+ years experience preferred in web development.

Campus Life, consistent with the academic mission of the University, strives to create positive growth environments for students by providing programs, services, and facilities that promote educational, social, and cultural development to more than 10,000 students at NC State.

If interested apply throughÂ http://jobs.ncsu.edu/postings/36583

Student Web Designer summer job with ITECS

April 18, 2014 in Uncategorized

Work with the NCSU ITECS web development team to create responsive website designs that conform to the NCSU Brand guidelines. Work with the team to create WordPress themes from initial designs for use across multiple client sites.Â 

See full job ad at

http://design.ncsu.edu/designlife/2014/04/14/student-web-designer-opportunity-with-ncsu-information-technology-and-engineering-computer-services/

Student Position: Web Developer

March 26, 2014 in Uncategorized

The office of OIT-Outreach Technology has two part time openings available for a web and mobile developer.Â  Projects will include work on web applications, mobile applications, tools and APIs that are used across campus by students, faculty and staff.

Â 

Candidates should be familiar or have experience with some of the following technologies:

  • PHP
  • Java
  • Git
  • MySQL
  • Android SDK
  • Google Services

Â 

Please submit your resume and a code sample to mobile@ncsu.edu.
